title: Dear Riot, Please Buff Tower damage
body: I'm actually fine with the current semi-low tower HP it makes the game shorter and you get more off winning a team fight than back in the day. BUT, tower damage is pathetic right now, especially tier 1's their is no longer an incentive to fight under tower. I got used to being able to outplay dives on multiple champions but these days the damage is all on the player. A tier 1 turret wont bring a tank at lvl 6 with half an item below half hp in 4 shots. Please rito do better

replies.body: Outer turret health as well as damage is going up in preseason :)

Gesundheit!

What people wanted is to just have us jack up turret damage and turret hp and leave it at that. Doing so would make low mmr games drag on forever, as well as completely dissuade turret dives at all. Turrets at the end of the day are intended to be objectives that a team captures to progress the game, not an impenetrable building that prevents action in a game. In preseason we're changing turret mechanics quite a bit to allow us to make them stronger, which we couldn't have done on a normal patch in a season.

except, right now, I literally can dive on an olaf at level 3, kill the target under the tower, and 9/10 not die in the process because the tower does maybe 50-75 damage to me.. this is just with a jungle item and with a bit into the resolve runes.. something standard in most "tank" junglers pick up now. 

Towers up til level 6-7 should be safe havens.. right now, they're just speed bumps. 

Taking away first tower gold should also be a priority. you want to curve snowballing, but leave first tower gold in the game proves you're lying about wanting to curve snowballing. Towers are so weak now, that I'm seeing towers in silver/gold dropping at the 4 minute mark in game thanks to 4 man bot ganks, something that because towers being so weak, is common bronze through diamond..

How low was the olaf?
How low were you?
Were you ranged?
Did you have any help?

So many questions to ask, if you can really tower dive an olaf at level 3, I'd love to see you do it solo when both of you are at full HP. News flash you lose.

What a load of nonsense.

All players wanted on the western side was for towers to be reverted to back before they were tinkered with.

Towers were ALWAYS an objective, there was NEVER an instance when they were not.

All you are doing now is giving towers a pointless shield to make it look like you are doing your jobs when towers never needed a gimmicky shield in the first place, yet another instance of change for change sake.

As for low MMR games dragging to long, they have always dragged too long and it has nothing to do with the towers.
It's got everything to do with a failure to educate newer players on how to close games.
Jeez... It's only in recent times that the worst tutorial in video game history actually got changed.

But still, there is NO MENTION in the tutorial on how capturing objectives and causing pressure is what really wins games.
So all that low MMR players do is run around like aimless chickens chasing down kills until the minions close out the games for them.

Turret diving still needs to be punishable if you can't get in and out quickly. In far too many cases, you can ignore the turret with high enough HP and basically loiter around under while you fight your opponents. Back in the day, ONLY when you were building heavy armor and defenses could you shrug off turret fire, but nowadays it seems like if anyone with a Black Cleaver and Ninja Tabi dives you, they can sit and have a coffee on your corpse before leisurely walking away. I'm not saying jack it up to 11 here, but right now, turret damage feels like it's at about a 3 when it should be closer to 5 or 6.

Only a fool believes in what you believe.
First things first, let's change turret sturdiness and see how that pans out. The whole point of these changes isn't to reinvent the laning phase from the ground up.

Interestingly according to patch history, tower dives have been more riskier than ever before.

Turret ramped up over 4 shots from 225% to 3 shots from 220%, and the bonus stays when switching champion targets in patch 6.9

Base damage last change was still before season 1, reading to patch is hard to make out what it really means, but 1st turret decreased to 112 from 115, no numbers on 2nd turret, 3rd turret increased to 227 from 226. The patch before it has inhib turrets reduce base damage to 210 from 226

4.20 had the earliest health changes, and other changes were before season 1. Base health went from 1200 -> 1000-2000 for outer and inner turrets, and 1500-2500 for turrets in base, along with 100 armor, double if no minions are by the turret. Effective healths of 2000-4000, and 3000-5000 when there's minions for the turrets respectively.

Now we have
3600 HP outer turrets + 5 mins of fortification for 50% damage reduction, not included in bot lane, with 40 resistances, effective hp of ~6800 for 5 mins
Same applies to inner turrets minus the fortification.
Takes 66% less damage when no minions are nearby applies to all turrets
Inhibs have 3300 HP down from 3600 and nexus have 2700 down from 3600 on the same patch 8.11

If you ask me, aside from the base turrets, lane turrets are pretty damn strong and way more tanky at almost all times of the game, and they're all much more dangerous. In older days, we were just worse at tower diving, and S2 to maybe S4, or maybe just end of S3, no one ever grouped to push down a turret as fast as possible, we normally tried to farm for as long as possible, and kill the turret when it was low from minions, which is why lane phase lasted so long back then.

Edit:
I was very focused on the patch history so I missed a few things, because it seems it was never been in the patch notes, but outer and every other turret deal 152 and 170 AD respectively, which caps at 180 and 250-290 respectively, and the armor is at 55 rather than 40

Although i agree with your statement, i have some questions:
How long is too long in terms of diving turrets?
One, two, three, four or more seconds?

Keep in mind that the longest CC in League is with Ashe's long distance R and it caps out at 3.5 seconds. That's more than enough time for anyone to just leisurely walk towards you and hit you until you die. Morgana's Bindings are dangerously close to this cap (at 3 seconds). And let's not mention chain CCing is a thing, which can 100-0 a person without any means of retaliation.

So how many turret shots should champions take before having to get out?
Riot can definitely make turret shots do % max HP damage but that would only make any class be able to dive you, the spotlight clearly being on champs that are ranged or have quick means of disposing a target.

Should turret aggro juggle be a thing?
If you're being dove by a group, you can't realistically expect that the turret should at least be able to get a revenge kill unless the group heavily misplays or you manage to unload your damage quickly before the target reacts with a Flash.

There's actually two pretty easy solutions to this without going into neither percentage maximum health nor true damage territory:

1. Adjustments to AD scaling of Turrets.

2. Adjustments to Turret Unique Passives.

I'll go into the passive adjustments first.

#PASSIVE CHANGES:

**1. Penetrating Bullets' Armor Penetration increased to 50% from 30%.**

**2. Cap on Warming Up removed and every shot now deals 50% more damage instead of 40% more damage. Stacks run off after 5 seconds without attacking an enemy champion.**

This makes it so Armor isn't completely useless against Turrets, but you still have to think carefully about being under them for too long.

#AD SCALING CHANGES:

**1. Outer Turrets' starting AD reduced to 150 from 152.**

**2. Outer Turrets now get +5 AD every minute (stopping at 10:00) instead of +4 AD every minute (stopping at 7:00). Total AD cap increased to 200 AD from 180 AD.**

**3. Inner Turrets' starting AD increased to 200 AD from 170 AD.**

**4. Inner Turrets now get +5 AD at 5:00 and every minute after (stopping at 20:00) instead of +4 AD at 8:00 and every minute after (stopping at 27:00). Total AD is still capped at 250 AD.**

**5. Inhibitor Turrets' starting AD increased to 250 AD from 170 AD.**

**6. Inhibitor Turrets now get +5 AD at 10:00 and every minute after (stopping at 30:00) instead of +4 AD at 8:00 and every minute after (stopping at 37:00). Total AD cap increased to 300 AD from 290 AD.**

**7. Nexus Turrets' starting AD increased to 300 AD from 150 AD.**

**8. Nexus Turrets now get +10 AD at 20:00 and every minute after (stopping at 40:00) instead of +4 AD at 8:00 and every minute after (stopping at 37:00). Total AD cap increased to 500 AD from 270 AD.**

This is mostly to make Turret damage come online sooner and not make games end by 15-20 minutes.

Nexus Turrets especially got a huge buff, up to 500 damage per shot that ignores 50% Armor and is increased in damage by 50% for every shot against a champion, to be precise.

This is mostly because it's the last line of defense, so it should also be the strongest.

#TO MAKE SURE THIS DOESN'T GET OUT OF HAND:

**1. Attack Range on all Turrets lowered to 750 from 775.**

**2. Attack Speed on all Turrets lowered to 0.75 from 0.83.**

Turrets are supposed to hit hard, but they're neither snipers nor machine guns.
